BiblioData.Title: SPHERICAL FERRITE NANOPARTICLE AND METHOD FOR PRODUCTION THEREOF
BiblioData.Abstract: A method for producing spherical ferrite nanoparticles includes the steps of: preparing a first aqueous solution containing a disaccharide, an alkaline, an oxidation agent, seed particles and divalent iron ions; and conducting particle growth in the first aqueous solution to produce the spherical ferrite nanoparticles.

Claims.P: 1. A method for producing spherical ferrite nanoparticles, comprising the steps of:
preparing a first aqueous solution containing a disaccharide, an alkaline, an oxidation agent, seed particles and divalent iron ions; and
conducting particle growth in the first aqueous solution to produce the spherical ferrite nanoparticles.
2. The method as set forth in claim 1,

wherein the first aqueous solution is prepared by adding the seed particles and the divalent iron ions into a second aqueous solution containing the disaccharide, the alkaline and the oxidation agent.
3. The method as set forth in claim 1,

wherein the first aqueous solution is prepared by adding the alkaline and the seed particles into a third aqueous solution containing the divalent iron ions and the disaccharide to form a fourth aqueous solution and adding the oxidation agent into the fourth aqueous solution.
4. The method as set forth in claim 1, further comprising,
the step of adding trivalent iron ions into the first aqueous solution.
5. The method as set forth in claim 1,
wherein a concentration of the disaccharide in the first aqueous solution is set within a range of 0.1M to 5M; and
wherein a ratio of a concentration of the divalent iron ions to the concentration of the disaccharide is set within a range of 0.002 to 50.
6. The method as set forth in claim 1,
wherein the oxidation agent is at least one selected from the group consisting of a nitric acid, a nitrous acid, a nitrate and a nitrite.
7. Spherical ferrite nanoparticles produced through a particle growth in a first aqueous solution containing a disaccharide, an alkaline, an oxidation agent, seed particles and divalent iron ions.
8. The spherical ferrite nanoparticles as set forth in claim 7,

wherein the first aqueous solution is prepared by adding the seed particles and the divalent iron ions into a second aqueous solution containing the disaccharide, the alkaline and the oxidation agent.
9. The spherical ferrite nanoparticles as set forth in claim 7,

wherein the first aqueous solution is prepared by adding the alkaline and the seed particles into a third aqueous solution containing the divalent iron ions and the disaccharide to form a fourth aqueous solution and adding the oxidation agent into the fourth aqueous solution.
10. The spherical ferrite nanoparticles as set forth in claim 7, comprising,
a number-averaged particle size within a range of 30 nm to 250 nm,
wherein a ratio of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles falling within a range of +-40% for the number-averaged particle size are 95% or more for all of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles.
11. Surface-modified ferrite nanoparticles, comprising:
spherical ferrite nanoparticles produced through a particle growth in an aqueous solution containing a disaccharide, an alkaline, an oxidation agent, seed particles and divalent iron ions; and

at least one surface modification agent selected from the group consisting of a surface-active agent, a hydroxyl acid and a sugar alcohol, the at least one surface modification agent modifying surfaces of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles.
12. Composite ferrite nanoparticles, comprising:
spherical ferrite nanoparticles produced through a particle growth in an aqueous solution containing a disaccharide, an alkaline, an oxidation agent, seed particles and divalent iron ions; and

at least one surface covering agent selected from the group consisting of a polystyrene, a polyethylene, a polyacrylic acid ester, a polymethacrylic acid ester, a polyethylene glycol (PEG), a polyglycidyl methacrylate, a silica, and silane coupling agent; the at least one surface covering agent covering surfaces of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles.
13. Composite ferrite nanoparticles, comprising:

at least one surface modification agent selected from the group consisting of a surface-active agent, a hydroxyl acid and a sugar alcohol, the at least one surface modification agent modifying surfaces of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles; and

at least one surface covering agent selected from the group consisting of a polystyrene, a polyethylene, a polyacrylic acid ester, a polymethacrylic acid ester, a polyethylene glycol (PEG), a polyglycidyl methacrylate, a silica, and a silane coupling agent; the at least one surface covering agent covering modified surfaces of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles by the at least one surface modification agent.
14. Functional ferrite nanoparticles, comprising:
spherical ferrite nanoparticles produced through a particle growth in an aqueous solution containing a disaccharide, an alkaline, an oxidation agent, seed particles and divalent iron ions;
linker molecules coupled with surfaces of the spherical ferrite nanoparticles; and
probe molecules coupled with the linker molecules and capable of being specifically coupled with a substance to be examined.
